Kerala tourism simplified by free Kerala Travel Guide
Paradise Holidays has recently launched an e-book which is a comprehensive travel guide for those interested in visiting Kerala. This is a free e-book meant to give travelers a glimpse of all that Kerala has to offer. The book will help tourists identify all the places they’d like to visit in Kerala, and plan their travel itinerary based on the locations of various travel destinations.
Every traveler would prefer to have a basic idea of the place they are planning to visit. This Kerala Travel Guide by Paradise Holidays provides just the right information that visitors to Kerala are looking for. This is one free e-book that everyone should get their hands on before planning a trip to Kerala.
When planning a trip, it is very important to find out everything there is to know about the place. This e-book is an informative guide that highlights the most important travel destinations in the different districts of Kerala.
The entire book is written in an easy to follow format, with essential information and vibrant photographs to enthrall the reader. Going through this travel guide will make one more aware about the place they are planning to visit and give them more clarity. A cursory glance at the different districts will help the reader map their entire Kerala tour and plot all the important places they would like to visit.
The e-book was launched just this week and the Director of Paradise Holidays Cochin, Ratheesh R. Nath says, “Kerala is truly a traveler’s paradise! This travel guide has been prepared with the experience and expertise gained through our years in planning vacation for many guests visited Kerala. This has been perfectly hand crafted for anyone planning to visit Kerala, to make their visit truly memorable. We wanted to provide our readers with a simple guide that would give them an overview of all that Kerala has to offer.”
He further adds, “This e-book offers detailed information on the 14 districts of Kerala, along with a list of major tourist destinations in each district. We believe it is an excellent resource, and a must read for anyone interested in visiting Kerala.” To get a hold of this free e-book all one needs to do is sign up for it through their official website.
